Reviews.Title: Incredible Camera
Reviews.Author: Paulette Angove
Reviews.Content: I was debating between the Nikon D7000 and the D3200 to replace my worn D60. For the money, I am delighted that I chose the D3200. It's light weight, and quiet.The tutoring menu is more for beginners, and it has many pre-sets to take creative shots easily. Love the 24MP, and find no noise even shooting at 6400 ISO.I bought it to shoot stills, but it has excellent HD video with slow motion.You do have to run manual with the older lenses, but that has only caused me to up my game.It's the most excellent DSLR value currently available!!

Reviews.Title: Water Polo Mamarazzi Recommended
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "US Pinay"
Reviews.Content: Used this camera to take pictures of my daughter's water polo games.  Pictures were fantastic!  Good camera for people who love taking pictures but have no time to muck around with understanding all the camera's technicalities.  Having a 24 megapixel resolution allow real tight cropping without loss of clarity.  Must have!

Reviews.Title: My camera looks and operates as advertised....
Reviews.Author: Gary Causer
Reviews.Content: The camera was reconditioned like new. Worked great right out of the box. And I saved a couple of hundred bucks. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: Making Old Lenses Useful Again
Reviews.Author: tupenc
Reviews.Content: if you have Nikon lenses from an old 35mm, this is a great buy that allows to you to use those lenses, & "move into the digital era," without feeling like you have wasted money on something you will never use again, with old lenses.  Only draw back is autofocus functions don't work with AF lenses, without the adapter, which adds additional cost.  But if you like to do your own focusing, the good old fashion way, great way to have a high quality camera, at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: No warranty beware
Reviews.Author: R Ravishankar
Reviews.Content: product is good, does not appear to be in original packaging.Defenitely no warranty card inside package.buying extended warranty with canopy. Hope it will be ok !Product works good and looks new

Reviews.Title: Best cheapest DSLR on the market!
Reviews.Author: Sole
Reviews.Content: I have been using this DSLR for about 9 months heavily. I use it mainly forportraits on the beach with a lot of dust, salt, air, humidity and sun of course.From my point of view this specific camera can give a professional looking images.It has never let me down and i paid it of in 7 days :-).I normally use it with toking 11-16mm, nikkor 17-55mm f2.8 and nikkor 50mm 1.8G.I highly recommend it to all the newbies.Cheers

Reviews.Title: Great Camera !
Reviews.Author: John Blayse
Reviews.Content: Very good camera. With DX CMOS 24.2MP, you can take photos in a large area. Quality of photo is very good even in low-light. You can easy sharing your photos via WIFI. This camera is also very easy to use. The body is quite light. Interestingly, you can use your smart phone (android, ios - I use iPhone) to remote this via an app. This is a best cheap camera you should buy up to now.This is the necessary lens fot D3200 DX:B001S2PPT0

Reviews.Title: Great digital slr
Reviews.Author: Richard Lee
Reviews.Content: As a former professional photographer (with many different Canon and Nikon 35mm SLR bodies), I did a lot of research and finally purchased the Nikon D3200.  It is light, fast for my needs, and takes all of my Nikon F-mount lenses (though the AF system only works with Nikon F-mount lenses with integrated autofocus, i.e., AF-S (introduced in 1996) or AF-I (introduced in 1992) lenses).  While this is not a professional camera body, it will meet the needs of any shooter (including professionals who want an inexpensive back-up body).  I highly endorse this camera; it meets all of my family, vacation, outdoor, and sports photography needs.

Reviews.Title: Super resolution
Reviews.Author: Thomas R. Dunning
Reviews.Content: I have had a d70 for a long time and I love it. The d3200 is smaller and lighter. Operation is very easy and it will show me anything I don't know. The most remarkable thing is the resolution. 24 megapixels. The pictures I take are absolutely beautiful. At $500 for the body only (I have lenses) it is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, pair it with the lens of your choice.
Reviews.Author: Vee
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love this camera.  Paired it with the Sigma 18-250mm lens also from amazon instead of getting the bundle and having to buy a separate long lens.  I've owned professional equipment and this is just as good for the modern family looking for great pics.  Easy to use, and easy on the wallet.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: bakranz
Reviews.Content: Enjoying it so far. Beyond my expectations of what I was looking for. It is a wonderful camera for me

Reviews.Title: Looked brand spankin new!
Reviews.Author: zook Montague
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best camera i have ever had! Works wonders! Thank you so much! Im gonna go shoot all the time!

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Jimmy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a up-grade from my Nikon D3100 and I'm sad to say that today I choose my Nikon D3100 over my up-grade the Nikon D3200...I don't know if I got a lemon or what but the quality of my pictures are very poor with this Nikon D3200...I've read the manual, I've tried every setting, I'm still unable to produce a quality photo with this camera. I've been using Nikon products for 25 years,  and I'm in shock over this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Product,
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great product. Functions smoothly. I had the D80 so upgrading to D3200 was important. Nikon produces products that exceed a user expectation

Reviews.Title: Late user of Nikon products, very satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Jack M Seaman
Reviews.Content: Camera was just as advertised and arrived on time during Christmas holidays. It looks like a real winner for the price.This camera body was ordered with a Sigma 18-250mm lens which did not fit the camera body at all to my satisfaction and was therefore returned for a Nikon 55-300mm lens that works very well with the D3200 camera. As always you can depend on great service from Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: So far Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jim Stamps
Reviews.Content: So far so good. I have using the camera a few months now and find it a good step up from my old D40X. I am still getting used to it. Shot some video with this. Only wish there was an in-camera rotate for the video. I am definitely getting used to the video feature. I would recommend this camera to anyone wanting to get more serious about their imaging.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I like Nikon products. I had a D50 or several years until it gave out. The 3200 is an upgrade and works fine so far.

Reviews.Title: Excellent in all respects
Reviews.Author: Ashton Brereton
Reviews.Content: For about two years now I have been using for bird photography, a Nikon D3000 mated to 1,4 Teleconverter and an AF-S Nikkor 300mm lens. I decided that it was time for me to upgrade but I wanted to do so at reasonable cost and easy carrying weight. So after doing my research I decided on the D3200. I made the correct choice. I find that it has more or less the same feel and weight of the D3000 and my teleconverter and lens work  perfectly with it. Additionally, apart from the major upgrade in pixels per image, it focuses very quickly, takes multiple frames in a flash and is ready to shoot even while it is still saving data from a previous shot. The picture quality is very high and if required the supplied software - or any similar ones for that matter - allows for all the usual computer processing, I recommend it unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Cam Body for the Price
Reviews.Author: flatiron'er
Reviews.Content: Great DSLR body for beginners stepping outside the "Auto" realm for the price. I wouldn't bother ever purchasing a kit lens with any camera.  Body is the only way to go, as kit lenses are never worth a darn.

Reviews.Title: New camera I think, but all else terrible
Reviews.Author: Fran
Reviews.Content: Seller listed as:Brand new, not refurbished! Ships in a brand new Nikon retail kit box  What I received  was a worn out box with the a sticker that read Refurbished, bags were resealed with masking tape.  The owners manual was used as you could tell from the frayed edges.  The camera was wrapped in used bubble wrapped and not done professionally.  There was some kind of dust on everything.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: GONZO
Reviews.Content: Great buy and I like the idea of buying things seperate. I also got a great deal on a 18 x 200 lens.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with this so far! It has been refurbished and has a 90 day warranty so I am hoping nothing goes wrong, but this is an excellent camera with excellent quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D3200 DX Format Camera
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: Camera is a great camera and was delivered within reasonable time.  The operational manual was, however, in Japanese so I had to print out a large one from the Internet which is too large to carry along on field trips.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: bill
Reviews.Content: As advertised, looks, feels and works as a brand new camera. Great deal, only needed body as I already had lenses from my D3100. Nice inexpensive upgrade!  Vendor was very responsive with my two inquiries.

Reviews.Title: So far, Nikon D3200 is great...I'm still learning all the things it can do
Reviews.Author: adman "adman"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a new Nikon D3200 ---just the body only because I already had an older Nikon and purchased two lenses for it - because I wanted to upgrade.  The older Nikon did not take videos, plus there were other improvements I wanted.So far, I'm very impressed with the 3200 -- but at this point in time I'm still learning more about its capabilities.  I haven't yet done much in the way of videos but I will be taking some in the near future.Also, the 3200 allows the use of Nikon's Wireless Mobile Utility -- which you purchase separately, but I think it's well worth the extra cost.  You plug it into the side of the camera body, and when you turn the 3200 on, a green light on the attachment begins to blink.  Then, using a mobile device (in my case, that would be the iPad2, iPodTouch I own or the Samsung Galaxy Centura smartphone my wife recently purchased for herself), you turn on the Nikon app that is associated with the attachment.You can then either use the device as a viewfinder and, if you wish, complete the exposure remotely, or you can download to your mobile device all the exposures that you have taken earlier on the 3200.  Some people have complained that the attachment does not work -- or is unreliable -- but once I got the hang of how it works, found it to work quite well.  (You just have to remember to momentarily move from the WiFi network you're probably on with your mobile device-- the one that you use with your home computer -- and select the network that the Nikon attachment creates as soon as it's plugged into the 3200.  As soon as you're done with the mobile attachment and remove it from your camera, your mobile device usually will switch back automatically to the WiFi network.By the way, because I did not care to sell the older Nikon I had, I'm keeping it and using it in a special way -- I have several pre-digital SLR camera lenses, some of them from a Canon camera I used in the 1970s for work-related projects -- and I located a company that manufactures adapters that allow you to affix the older lenses onto a DSLR.  You're never quite sure what kind of quality you're going to get, but the results can be interesting.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for beginners who want something more than a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Gail Barsh
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic bargain. Nikon lives up to its name with this camera. It provides many options for the user. Highly recommend researching You Tube videos for a tutorial on setup and use as there are so many options; whether you want to just put it in automatic and let the camera do all the work, use the program, aperture priority, shutter priority, or take it to manual to manipulate your photo outcomes, this camera can do it all. A great buy, you are limited to your imagination.

Reviews.Title: Maintains the Nikon commitment to quality.
Reviews.Author: P. Schwartz "Siva-06"
Reviews.Content: I have been a Nikon owner and user for over 40 years and this camera is another example of their commitment to quality and user ergonomics.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: C. DICKSON
Reviews.Content: Perfect for personal or professional use. The D3200 has very similar technology to more expensive bodies. Save yourself the money, purchase this camera and use the extra money to buy nice glass and that's all you're going to need.

Reviews.Title: Used camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Long
Reviews.Content: the camera was refurbished and so far it's been great....... Love the camera,  It looks like a brand new camera right out of the box.  I'll order another one when that time comes.  Great price,  and wonderful camera

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price.
Reviews.Author: Marion
Reviews.Content: Replacement for my D3100 that I dropped. But hey, it was a upgrade! Lots of extra features and megapixels. Great camera for a great price!

Reviews.Title: GREAT VALUE
Reviews.Author: Arnold T. Serrata "Nolo Serrata"
Reviews.Content: A great value; excellent camera that more than met my expectation for a more than fair price.  I am totally happy with the results of this camera paired with the Nikon 40mm micro dx, the Nikon 18-105mm vr dx and soon the Nikon 55-300 vr dx lenses.  The pictures are easy to take and are clear and colorful, both outdoors and indoors and day or night.  Amazon.com made it happen; convenient, safe, and delivers on time according to plan.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D3200
Reviews.Author: As I See It today "Scifi n Mystery Guy"
Reviews.Content: I have been taking pictures for 46 years starting with a Kodak 620 reflex film camera.  In college I upgraded to a Contax 139 Quartz.  This was treat for a serious hobbyist.  It took many years after digital imaging arrived before I put a toe in the water.  My wife and I picked up a cheap point and shoot 3mP for a vacation.  One of the shots won an award at a local festival.  This changed my mind about digital.As an interim jump we picked the FugiFilm FinePix S9000.  What makes this camera shine is the FinePix picture engine, great low light and flash photos and a comfortable sealed unit.  It also uses AA batteries that can be purchased anywhere.  These features make it a great camera for travel everywhere.  Poster sized enlargements can be made without distortion.  The downside is that the LCD is small and the eye piece is not through the lens.It was time to upgrade to a true D-SLR.  After conducting extensive research we set our sights on the Nikon line.  Comparing Nikon feature to feature with the competition most things were equal except Nikon cameras felt better in my hands.  The controls, handling and balance were close to my old Contax 139Q.So far the photos have been very good.  The option to go semi or full manual opens up a world of creativity.  Having the ability to work with RAW files also expands artistic options.  I am very pleased with the speed, flexibility and functionality of this unit.  Can't wait to get the WiFi adapter working with an Android device.  The software for this is only available at Google Play for Android.  Make sure your tablet, phone meet the requirements before purchasing the WiFi Device.

Reviews.Title: Camera Great--service not so much
Reviews.Author: Gail Schmidt
Reviews.Content: The camera is a good one, love the features, but the seller failed to get it to the UPS store in the necessary time limits for me to receive it on the LATEST expected date. I had to fight with UPS to try to get it to me faster before an important trip.

ProductInfo.Features:
24.2MP DX-Format CMOS Sensor
EXPEED III Image Processor
3" 921K-Dot LCD
11-Point Autofocus
HD 1080p Video
Live View
Up To ISO 12800
Optional WU-1a Wireless Mobile Adapter
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon D3200 24.2 MP Digital SLR Camera (Body Only) International Model No Warranty (Black, Open Box)
